---------------------------------------------------------------------
Louis L&#039;Amour&#039;s world is built on those dramatic moments when men and 
women cast their fears, doubts, and pasts behind them and plunge into the 
unknown. Nowhere is that more evident than in this latest collection of stories 
set on the American frontier. The selections include The Nester and the Piute; 
Big Man; Waltz Him Around Again, Shadow; Barney Takes a Hand; When a 
Texan Takes Over; and No Trouble for the Cactus Kid. Even at the best of 
times, this is a world in which every man and woman must be responsible for 
their own survival.

The characters in these pulse-pounding stories are vintage L&#039;Amour. 
Together these stories bring to life the American spirit and confirm Louis 
L&#039;Amour&#039;s place at the very top of the pantheon of American writers.

----

Louis L&#039;Amour is the only novelist in history to receive both the Presidential 
Medal of Freedom and the Congressional Gold Medal. He has published ninety 
novels; twenty-nine short-story collections; two works of nonfiction; a 
memoir, Education of a Wandering Man; and a volume of poetry, Smoke from 
This Alter. There are more than 300 million copies of his books in print.

----

Jason Culp has appeared on television in Days of Our Lives and General 
Hospital and in the film Skinheads. His many theatrical performances include 
the role of Trigorin in The Seagull.
